parameters.content:
## Amazon Luna ‚Äì Fetch ‚ÄúIncluded with Prime‚Äù Games

#### How it works

1. **Scheduled Trigger** ‚Äì starts the workflow every 5 days at 3:00 PM (you can change the frequency and time).
  
2. **HTTP Request** ‚Äì queries Amazon Luna‚Äôs official endpoint to retrieve the list of ‚ÄúIncluded with Prime‚Äù games.
  
3. **Code Node (JavaScript)** ‚Äì processes the JSON response and extracts the title, release year, genres, ASIN, and images.
  
4. **Google Sheets** ‚Äì automatically saves or updates the data in a Google Sheet, avoiding duplicates.
  

#### Parameters to configure 

in the node Edit Fields:

* **x-amz-locale** Defines the language and region of the request.Supported options include:
  
  * `it_IT` üáÆüáπ (Italy)
    
  * `en_US` üá∫üá∏ (USA)
    
  * `de_DE` üá©üá™ (Germany)
    
  * `fr_FR` üá´üá∑ (France)
    
  * `es_ES` üá™üá∏ (Spain)
    
  * `en_GB` üá¨üáß (United Kingdom)
    
  * `ja_JP` üáØüáµ (Japan)
    
  * `en_CA` üá®üá¶ (Canada)
    
* **x-amz-marketplace-id** Amazon marketplace identifier that corresponds to the selected region.Common values:
  
  * `APJ6JRA9NG5V4` üáÆüáπ (Italy)
    
  * `ATVPDKIKX0DER` üá∫üá∏ (USA)
    
  * `A1PA6795UKMFR9` üá©üá™ (Germany)
    
  * `A13V1IB3VIYZZH` üá´üá∑ (France)
    
  * `A1RKKUPIHCS9HS` üá™üá∏ (Spain)
    
  * `A1F83G8C2ARO7P` üá¨üáß (UK)
    
  * `A1VC38T7YXB528` üáØüáµ (Japan)
    
  * `A2EUQ1WTGCTBG2` üá®üá¶ (Canada)
    
* **Accept-Language** Preferred response language. Example:`it-IT,it;q=0.9,en;q=0.8` (adjust for your region as needed).
  
* **User-Agent** Browser agent string used in the request header.You can keep the default value or replace it with a more recent one.
  
* **Trigger interval** Defines how often the workflow runs automatically.Default: every 5 days at 3:00 PM (can be changed).
  
* **Google Sheet** Destination where the data will be stored or updated.Select your document and worksheet when configuring the Google Sheets node.
  

#### Tips

* You can adjust **locale** and **marketplace-id** to retrieve results from different countries (e.g., USA, Germany, Japan).
  
* The **Title** field is used as a key to prevent duplicates when updating records.
  
* The workflow can easily be adapted to export data to CSV, Airtable, or any database.
  

#### ‚ö†Ô∏è Important notes

* The data retrieved belongs to Amazon and should only be used for personal or testing purposes.
  
* Do not republish or redistribute the results without permission.

assignments.name: User-Agent
assignments.value: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/141.0.0.0 Safari/537.36

parameters.content:
## üìå **New Games Notification**

*This section of the workflow handles the automatic delivery of notifications when new games are detected.

## üîß How it works

1. After the first part of the workflow finishes processing the data, the nodes filter only the newly-added items.
2. Each new item is passed into a **Loop** node.
3. The **HTTP Request** node performs the **download of the file** associated with the item (for example images or metadata).
4. A short delay is applied using a **Wait** node to prevent rate-limit issues with external services.
5. Finally, each new item is delivered through the selected notification channel (Discord or any other provider).

#### üîÑ Why ‚ÄúLoop‚Äù and ‚ÄúWait‚Äù?

These nodes are included to **avoid rate limiting** on external services such as Discord or Telegram.
By sending messages one at a time, with a short pause in between, you prevent:

* message throttling,
* blocked requests,
* temporary bans from the provider.


---

nodes.name: Append or update row in sheet

parameters.content:
### 1. Create a Discord Application

1. Go to: [https://discord.com/developers/applications](https://discord.com/developers/applications)
2. Click **New Application**, choose a name, and save.

### 2. Turn the application into a Bot

1. In the left menu, open **Bot** ‚Üí ‚ÄúAdd Bot‚Äù.
2. Click **Reset Token** to generate the bot token ‚Üí copy and store it securely.

### 3. Enable Bot Permissions

In **Privileged Gateway Intents**:

* Enable **Message Content Intent**.

Save the configuration.

### 4. Invite the bot to your Discord server

1. Go to **OAuth2 ‚Üí URL Generator**.
2. Select the scope: **bot**.
3. Under permissions, enable **Send Messages** (and ‚ÄúEmbed Links‚Äù if needed).
4. Copy the generated invite link and open it in your browser.
5. Choose your server ‚Üí the bot is now added (it stays offline until used via API).

### 5. Create a channel for notifications

1. In your Discord server, create a new text channel.
2. Right-click the channel ‚Üí **Copy Channel ID**
   (If you don‚Äôt see this, enable **Developer Mode** under User Settings ‚Üí Advanced.)

### 6. Connect Discord to n8n

In the Discord node:

1. Insert your **Bot Token** in the credentials.
2. Paste the **Channel ID**.
3. Map the message content (title, link, image, etc.).

**Alternative:**
Instead of using a bot, you can use a **Discord Webhook**:

* Create a webhook in *Channel Settings ‚Üí Integrations ‚Üí Webhooks*.
* Use an **HTTP Request** node (POST) to send JSON payloads to the webhook URL.

## üîÑ Replacing Discord with another notification provider

You can easily replace the Discord node with any other service, such as:

* Telegram (via Bot API)
* Email (via SMTP)
* WhatsApp (via API or third-party services)
* Slack / Microsoft Teams (webhooks)
* Pushbullet / Matrix / Bark, etc.

**Only the final message-sending node needs to be changed.**
All other logic stays the same.


1. After the list of games is processed, the **IF** node identifies which items are marked as *new*.
2. New items are passed to a **Loop Over Items** node.
3. Each item is then delayed using a **Wait** node.


---
